intro: Hieracium levicaule subsp. sbaense, commonly known as the Sbaen Scurfweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. It has rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Hieracium species.
